#id=1
#text=One afternoon , I decided to go to the library to check out some books and movies .
#id=2
#text=It was too far away to walk , so I decided to ride the bus .
#id=3
#text=I found a map and looked for my home and the library .
#id=4
#text=On the map , there was a symbol that stood for '' `` Bus '' '' at a street corner a block from where I lived .
#id=5
#text=There was another symbol for the bus on the road right in front of the library .
#id=6
#text=I looked up the name of each of these stops on the map , and it said that the Number 5 bus goes to both of these stops .
#id=7
#text=It also listed what times the Number 5 bus arrives at each of these stops .
#id=8

#text=When it was a few minutes before the bus was due to arrive at the stop at my street corner , I checked my piggy bank and took out some dollar bills and quarters , and then I walked to the bus stop .
#id=9
#text=After waiting for a few minutes , a big bus that said '' `` Number 5 '' '' pulled up , and the driver opened the door .
#text=I walked on and read the sign explaining the fare .
#text=I paid exactly what the sign said into the machine near the driver and found a seat near the middle of the bus .
#text=As the bus drove down the road , the names of each stop appeared in writing near the front of the bus .
#text=An electronic voice also said the names out loud so that the deaf would know what stop they are approaching .
#text=Sometimes the bus driver would stop and let more people on board , and sometimes people got off .
#text=Sometimes there was nobody waiting at a stop and nobody trying to get off , so the driver kept on moving .
#text=When I saw the name of the stop outside the library appear , I pulled a big yellow cord hanging above the window .
#text=This made a noise and notified the bus driver that I wanted to get off at this stop .
#text=He stopped the bus when we arrived , opened the doors , and I got off to enjoy my afternoon at the library .
